msg: Started the development of the new ModelSpec documentation, added a

author: chris-dollin
msg: Fixed problem in GraphExtract where extracting into an existing graph which
already has some triple(s) (R, p, o) for [sub]root R would not add any
triples for R from the graph being extracted from.
This was because the test for "already seen" was the existence in the
destination graph of (R, ANY, ANY), which works fine if that graph
starts out empty - but because we expose and use the "update" form,
Resorted to using an "active node" set. Also refactored the core code
into a nested class to allow the elimination of most of the parameter

author: chris-dollin
msg: Added ModelExtract, which wraps GraphExtract, and the Statement*Boundary*
types which raise TripleBoundarys to the Statement level.

author: chris-dollin
msg: Added TestModelExtract and hence StatementBoundary and ModelExtract.
Tweaks to GraphExtract et al. InfModelSpec now uses ModelExtract
